contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 16, 1933 D Long Eaton Contest
Long Eaton Contest 10 Own Choice Test Piece Contest Long Eaton Contest long-eaton-contest
None
Test Piece Contest
I Capuleti [unknown arranger]
Recreation Ground, Long Eaton Prizes - 1st £10 and cup, 2nd £7, 3rd £5. Hymn tune contest - 1st(£1) Kirkby Old, 2nd(10s.) B Winning and Blackwell Colliery, 3rd divided between Welbeck Colliery and Stanton Ironworks. Correction in Brass Band News November 1933 states - "I notice the Long Eaton contest is wrongly reported in B.B.N. It should have read : 1st Stanton Ironworks, 2nd B Winning and Blackwell Colliery, 3rd Holme. Long Eaton did not competed" H.Evetts. 7 bands competed.
Dec. 20, 2013, 1:08 p.m. April 26, 2018, 8:54 a.m.
1 Long Eaton Silver Prize Band Henry Evetts
2 Ilkeston Brass Unknown
3 B Winning and Blackwell Colliery Unknown
Unknown Result Kirkby Old Unknown
Unknown Result Welbeck Colliery Unknown
